title: Lesson 75
paragraph: This lesson focuses on power and influence, including authoritative, commanding, and strategic qualities.

words.meaning: able to be trusted as being accurate or true; commanding
words.example: The book is considered an authoritative source on the subject.

words.meaning: having a position of authority; impressive
words.example: The general had a commanding presence.

words.meaning: having a confident and forceful personality
words.example: She was assertive in expressing her opinions.
The dominant company controlled the market.

words.meaning: carefully designed or planned to serve a particular purpose
words.example: They made a strategic decision to expand overseas.

words.meaning: good at convincing someone to do or believe something
words.japaneseMeaning: 説得力のある、納得させる
words.example: Her argument was persuasive and well-supported.
The nation is a sovereign state.

words.meaning: having great influence on someone or something
words.japaneseMeaning: 影響力のある、勢力のある
words.example: She is an influential leader in the community.

words.meaning: using force or threats to make someone do something
words.example: The regime used coercive tactics to maintain control.
He made a forceful argument during the debate.
